title: ‘I’ll beat you tomorrow for $10k’: Inside the secret world of MLB pickleball
content: Here's how the pickleball court is replacing the golf course as where the baseball world gets away from the game.

title: Ejected Chisholm rips ump on X, then deletes post
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr. was ejected from the New York Yankees' 6-3 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays on Thursday night, then appeared to violate Major...

title: Coach Prime responds to jersey retirement critics
content: Deion Sanders responded to criticism from former Colorado players on Thursday who claim the retirement of jersey numbers for Travis Hunter and Shedeur Sanders is too soon.

title: Rodgers still unsure on future, rips Jets for exit
content: Future Hall of Fame quarterback Aaron Rodgers said Thursday on "The Pat McAfee Show" that he is not ready to make a decision on his plans for the 2025 season and allowed that retirement could still be a possibility.

title: Ex-South Alabama QB Lopez commits to UNC
content: Former South Alabama quarterback Gio Lopez, one of the top passers in the spring transfer portal, has committed to North Carolina, he announced on social media Thursday.

title: Ovi closes historic season with 897th career goal
content: Alex Ovechkin scored his 44th goal of the season to move his all-time record total to 897 on Thursday in the Capitals' 5-2 loss to the Penguins in the regular-season finale.

title: Stricken by bite, Texas' Corbin nearly missed start
content: Rangers lefty Patrick Corbin said an apparent venomous bite on his foot made it difficult for him to walk and nearly forced him to miss Wednesday's start against the Angels.

title: Saints' Ramczyk, 30, retires: 'Incredible journey'
content: Saints right tackle Ryan Ramczyk anounced his retirement from the NFL on Thursday after seven seasons.

title: Luka relishes chance to take on Wolves' Gobert
content: Lakers star Luka Doncic happily reminisced about his game-winning 3 over Wolves center Rudy Gobert in last year's playoffs and said he would welcome the four-time NBA Defensive Player of the Year trying to guard him again in their first-round series.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: Winners and losers: Picks we loved -- and picks that left us scratching our heads
content: Will Sedona Prince play in the WNBA? Is Dominique Malonga a future MVP? We revisit all the WNBA draft picks.

title: What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: Man United breathe life into an otherwise dismal season with a legendary comeback
content: Man United almost lost to 10-man Lyon before waging a thrilling comeback. The flaws make United's Europa League run what it is.

title: NBA postseason preview: Stars, matchups and X factors that could decide the champion
content: Everything you need to know about the teams battling it out in the postseason, including first-round matchups.

title: How little old Vanderbilt is making noise in the big, bad SEC
content: From beating Bama to boasting a brash QB, Clark Lea and the Commodores are convinced the best is yet to come.

title: Man Utd inspired by '99 triumph in wild comeback
content: Ruben Amorim said he watched Manchester United's 1999 documentary for "inspiration" before his team fought back to record a stunning victory over Lyon.

title: Not done yet: Ange, Spurs sneak into UEL semis
content: Ange Postecoglou told his critics they will "have to put up with me for just a little bit longer" after Tottenham Hotspur sealed a UEFA Europa League semifinal spot with a 1-0 win against Eintracht Frankfurt in Germany.

title: LaLiga seals 5 spots in '25'-'26 Champions League
content: LaLiga will join the Premier League in having five teams in the Champions League next season after it secured the second of the extra places.

title: Messi: New foreign players making MLS 'stronger'
content: Inter Miami CF star Lionel Messi said he's seen the level of Major League Soccer continue to rise as clubs sign young, foreign players, and said this season has been his most competitive yet since arriving to the South Florida team in the summer of 2023.

title: Marsch banned 2 games after red card vs. USMNT
content: Canada coach Jesse Marsch has been suspended for an extra game by Concacaf following his actions during the team's Nations League third-place playoff against the USMNT last month.

title: Report: Security failures led to Copa final chaos
content: Officials for Miami-Dade County said a lack of intelligence gathering, insufficient security perimeters and large numbers of unticketed fans led to the chaotic scene that unfolded ahead of last year's Copa América final.

title: Neymar exits in tears after fresh injury setback
content: Neymar suffered a fresh injury setback when the Brazil star was forced to leave Santos' match with Atlético-MG due to a left thigh injury.

title: Van Dijk signs contract extension at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has signed a contract extension, putting an end to speculation over whether this season would be his last at Anfield.

title: Champions League semifinal predictions: Arsenal or PSG? Barcelona or Inter Milan?
content: We're down to the final four in Europe's top club competition, so who do we think has the power, talent and grit to reach the final? Our writers make their picks.

title: Ideal landing spots for 10 of this year's rookies
content: A fantasy manager's guide to the ideal team fits for selected rookies such as Cam Ward and Ashton Jeanty.

title: Carroll hits 35 homers? Soderstrom hits 50? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Transfer tracker: Latest entrants and commitments
content: The transfer cycle is in full swing. We're tracking the latest players to enter the portal and commit.

title: How Liverpool sealed Salah, Van Dijk contracts amid struggle to keep Alexander-Arnold
content: Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have committed their futures to Liverpool, but how did the club convince them to stay? And will that persuade Trent Alexander-Arnold to snub Real Madrid?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern have advantage to sign Wirtz
content: Bayern believe they are in pole position to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: Will Ryan Garcia win a world title? What's the state of the 175-pound division? More
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on the May 2 card in Times Square, Usyk's next fight and more.

title: Duty imposed on steel, aluminium on security grounds, not safeguard measures: U.S. to India in WTO
content: India has said that America has failed to notify the WTO Committee on Safeguards under a provision of the Agreement on Safeguards (AoS) on taking a decision to apply safeguard measures

title: Christians hold Way of the Cross processions across Kerala on Good Friday
content: Church leaders guide their congregations in solemn processions through town centres in Kerala to reverently recall Christ’s message and his sacrifice for humanity’s spiritual betterment

title: Arms recovered in border area of Amritsar by BSF, Punjab Police
content: A well coordinated operation with swift execution by BSF troops and Punjab Police resulted in the recovery of weapons

title: This one-of-a-kind show in Mysuru proudly showcased ordinary objects that hold meaning for ordinary people
content: ‘Janapriya’ featured “treasures” from domestic help, well-travelled neighbours, and even a silver crown from Kannada cinema icon Dr. Rajkumar’s family

title: Good Friday inspires us to cherish kindness, compassion: PM Modi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi also recalled the sacrifice of Jesus Christ

title: How a 71-year-old Muslim villager’s “hoarding” of everyday objects won a coveted spot at the V&A Museum in London
content: Ohida Khandekar’s Dream Your Museum, an installation and film about her uncle’s collection won the V&A’s Jameel Prize for contemporary art and design inspired by Islamic traditions

title: A.P. cracker unit blast: Firework flashes and silhouetted grief
content: With nine people dying in a cracker factory blast in Andhra Pradesh, the spotlight is once again on thousands of untrained workers who risk their lives as they step into the hundreds of firecracker plants across the Anakapalli and Visakhapatnam districts

title: No hike in power tariffs after NDA came to power, says A.P. Energy Minister
content: The burdensome tariffs being borne by people are due to the steep hikes effected during the YSRCP term, says Energy Minister Ravi Kumar

title: DU professor 'advised' to submit speech text for permission to travel to U.S.
content: I received a mail from the registrar's office asking me to submit the text of my speech for approval. In my view, this is very alarming, says DU professor Apoorvanand Jha

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. hikes honorarium for Special Judicial Magistrates, releases ₹30 cr. for pastors’ stipend
content: The revised honorarium will be applicable retrospectively from April 1, 2019, says Minister for Law and Minority Welfare N.Md. Farooq

title: Voters swayed by money, liquor, gifts will be reborn as animals: Madhya Pradesh BJP MLA
content: A video of her purported remarks, made at a meeting on Wednesday in Hasalpur village in her Mhow Assembly constituency, went viral on social media, prompting the opposition Congress to slam the MLA for her “conservative thinking”

title: Fine print of an insurance fraud in Telangana
content: Across Telangana, fake insurance rackets are preying on unsuspecting vehicle owners, trapping accident victims and their families in endless legal battles for compensation that never comes. Lavpreet Kaur unravels how this insidious scam exploits the vulnerable and the cascading human cost it extracts

title: SolveCon 2025 brings together youth voice, action, and impact
content: The sixth edition of SolveCon saw youngsters participating in multiple activities from hands-on games to deep reflection and problem-solving

title: Not defamation if homebuyers peacefully protest against builders, SC holds
content: A right to protest peacefully without falling foul of the law is a corresponding right, which the consumers ought to possess just as the seller enjoys his right to commercial speech, the Bench observed

title: Seven decades on, a glimmer of hope for land rights in Karnataka
content: A joint survey is currently underway by the Revenue and Forest Department officials in all seven taluks of Shivamogga district to de-reserve forests in favour of those who lost land to the Sharavathi Hydel Power Project seven decades ago. Sathish G.T. visits survey sites to meet people who are hopeful of getting title deeds for their land, at least this time around

title: Patteda Anchu sarees: GI tag brings hope, but weavers need more to sustain the traditional craft
content: The colourful and durable Patteda Anchu sarees of Gajendragad recently got the Geographical Indication tag

title: Expert team collects soil samples from Polavaram project site
content: The soil samples will be tested in the Central Soil and Materials Research Station laboratory, they say

title: Plea for judicial enquiry into Group-I main exam: HC directs government not to issue appointment letters
content: The Judge said the government, however, can go ahead with the process of verification of certificates of candidates selected for the Group-I posts

title: Cracks emerge in GOP unity amid Trump trade war
content: Within the Republican party, responses were fractured, blending steadfast loyalty with rising alarm over inflation, supply chain disruptions, and the global perception of the U.S.’s unpredictability; even among MAGA loyalists, the tariffs drew scrutiny, with Elon Musk, the billionaire Trump donor, raising opposition, sparking a public spat with one of the President’s economic advisers, Peter Navarro

title: India dodges direct impact of China rare earth element curbs, but worries linger
content: While China’s curbs on rare earth elements (REEs) pale against India’s relatively tiny imports of the metals, officials have made mineral security a priority as it encourages more domestic manufacturing.

title: India will ascend to the highest position in every field: Shah
content: Shah was speaking at a national dialogue on ‘Self-Empowerment through Inner Awakening for Security Forces Personnel’ held at the headquarters of the Brahma Kumaris at Abu Road in Rajasthan

title: EU Naval Force proposes exercise to strengthen maritime cooperation
content: The envisaged exercise, if approved, would include two European ships practicing counter-piracy operations, tactical manoeuvres and communications with the Indian Navy.

title: VHP demands president rule in West Bengal
content: Accusing Mamata Banerjee government for its inaction over the violence against Hindus, VHP general secretary Milind Parande said that the organisation will seek time to meet President Droupadi Murmu and submit a memorandum

title: Panel that probed death of pregnant woman, who was denied treatment, submits report
content: The inquiry committee earlier found DMH violated emergency care protocols by reportedly refusing admission to the pregnant woman when she couldn’t pay a ₹10 lakh deposit

title: Murshidabad violence: 274 arrested, 60 FIRs lodged
content: According to West Bengal police 70% of shops have reopened in the violence affected areas and 85 people who fled have returned to their homes

title: Signs of a truce emerge between Ramadoss and Anbumani
content: According to sources in the party, the point of contention between the two was who has the power — the founder or the president of the party — to appoint district secretaries and State-level office-bearers

title: Issue arrest memo, reason for arrest to suspect during arrest: DG&IG tells Karnataka police
content: Recently, there have been several instances where police officials have been accused of illegal detention and later showing arrest, which ended up helping the accused secure bail

title: 12 locations in Tamil Nadu to be declared protected sites, monuments
content: Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu announces in the Assembly that a museum for inscriptions would be set up in World Tamil Sangam campus in Madurai

title: Over 100 ft tall Lord Murugan statues to come up in 3 temples in Tamil Nadu: HR and CE Minister
content: He also announces that fee will not be collected for special darshan on special occasions and festival days at major temples across the State

title: The peculiar political position of chieftains of the Dangs
content: In south Gujarat’s hilly forests of the Dang district, erstwhile kings and their kinspeople continue to try to negotiate for privileges and respect within the Indian Union. Alongside, the BJP’s carefully constructed rhetoric around tribal identity resonates with the Bhils, finds Abhinay Lakshman

title: ₹1,000 crore of REI Agro’s attached assets to be liquidated to repay victims in bank fraud case
content: Special court releases assets after no-objection from ED; most claimants are PSU banks cheated to the tune of ₹3,871.71 cr; liquidator cannot sell attached assets to anyone linked to the corporate debtors

title: Study presents mixed picture of MGNREGA implementation in Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Pradesh has shown improved participation and reversal of deletions, but work duration and wages continue to slide, as per the new report from LibTech India

title: Principles of liberty, equality and fraternity essential, says Chidambaram MP
content: Thol. Thirumavalavan pays rich tributes to  revolutionary and poet K.G. Sathyamurthy on the latter’s 13th death anniversary

title: Karnataka caste census: Further discussion deferred to Cabinet meeting in May
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has asked his Cabinet colleagues to submit in writing their opinion on the survey, even if it is a dissent note

title: World Circus Day: Life under the big top and beyond
content: As the circus industry heads to its sunset years, Nainu Oommen meets a few artistes at their camps and homes in Kannur to rekindle the memories of their golden days in the ring and on the trapeze. April 19 is World Circus Day.

title: BJP leaders visit sewage treatment plant at Appu Ghar in Visakhapatnam
content: Officials of a private firm assures the party leaders that the muddy water will be treated before release into the sea

title: Flying to US? Customs officers can search your phone, laptop...
content: US Customs and Border Protection officers are increasingly searching electronic devices of incoming passengers, including citizens. CBP can conduct basic searches without suspicion, but advanced searches require reasonable suspicion and managerial approval. Individuals should document interactions with CBP, understand their rights regarding password disclosure, and obtain receipts for detained devices.

title: 'Used burner phones to evade arrest': Punjab terror accused nabbed in US
content: Harpreet Singh, an alleged terrorist wanted in India for numerous violent crimes, was apprehended in Sacramento, California, by the FBI and US immigration authorities. Singh, also known as Happy Passia and Jora, is linked to two international terrorist groups and had illegally entered the US from Mexico in 2021.

title: JNU professor accused of molesting Japanese embassy official sacked
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) dismissed a senior faculty member following a sexual harassment complaint filed by a Japanese researcher after an incident at a university event. The university's Executive Council took the decision after an internal inquiry found the charges credible, reflecting JNU's zero-tolerance policy towards such misconduct.

title: Rohit Sharma finally reveals why he yelled 'Koi garden mein nahi ghoomega’
content: Rohit Sharma revealed the story behind his viral 'Koi garden mein nahi ghoomega' remark during the second Test against England in February 2024. He expressed frustration at the team's lack of urgency and intensity during a crucial partnership. Meanwhile, Rohit's recent struggles in the IPL continue, drawing criticism from Virender Sehwag, who suggested he safeguard his legacy.

title: Rajkot heist: Burglar steals 102 high-end watches worth Rs 70L in 23 minutes
content: In Rajkot, a lone thief executed a pre-dawn burglary at a prominent showroom in Trikon Baug, making off with approximately Rs 70 lakh worth of high-end wristwatches and cash. The 23-minute operation, targeting only expensive watches, occurred a short distance from the A Division police station. Police are analyzing CCTV footage and suspect the involvement of accomplices.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Tesla investor Ross Gerber has intensified his criticism of Elon Musk, asserting that Musk's focus has shifted to X AI and he no longer prioritizes Tesla. Gerber highlighted the negative impact of Musk's social media activity and political associations on Tesla's reputation. Despite a decline in Tesla's stock and sales, Gerber's firm continues to hold shares, anticipating a potential turnaround.

title: 6 pistols, 14 magazines recovered near India-Pakistan border in Amritsar
content: A joint operation by the BSF and Punjab Police near Amritsar resulted in the seizure of six pistols and 14 magazines from a field near the India-Pakistan border. Separately, in Tarn Taran, two alleged shooters linked to the Satta Naushera gang were injured in an encounter with police, leading to the recovery of Pakistan-made pistols.

title: Putin to students: 'You know, there's a person named Elon Musk...'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has publicly lauded Elon Musk, comparing him to Soviet space pioneer Sergei Korolev and acknowledging his ambitious Mars colonization plans. Putin's praise comes amidst heightened geopolitical tensions and scrutiny of Musk's controversial statements on global affairs, particularly regarding the conflict in Ukraine. Musk's Starlink network also places him at the center of ongoing geopolitical debates.

title: 'Uska jaane ka time aa gaya': Sehwag's message to Rohit
content: A disciplined performance from the bowling unit, spearheaded by Jasprit Bumrah and captain Hardik Pandya, powered Mumbai Indians to a four-wicket win over Sunrisers Hyderabad in a low-scoring clash at the Wankhede Stadium. Will Jacks emerged as the standout performer for Mumbai, picking up two key wickets and contributing a crucial 36 with the bat to steer the team to their second consecutive victory in IPL 2025.

title: ED raid at Bengaluru breeder's house shows Rs 50cr wolfdog story fake
content: A Bengaluru-based dog breeder, who claimed to have imported a rare Cadabomb Okami wolfdog from London for Rs 50 crore, was raided by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) over suspected FEMA violations. The ED found no trace of the exotic animal or documents to support the claim. The breeder’s viral photos of the alleged wolfdog were discovered to be of another animal, exposing the entire story as fabricated. No records of foreign payments or import permits were found.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke to parents: Make your kid learn …
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke advocates for early coding education, integrating it into school curriculums alongside subjects like physics and math. He highlights AI's role in democratizing software development, enabling beginners and small teams to achieve significant results. Dohmke encourages continuous learning for developers, emphasizing AI's potential to unlock new domains of innovation.

title: 75+ Good Friday messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2025
content: Good Friday, a day for reflection and spiritual renewal, offers an opportunity to share kindness and hope. Heartfelt messages, inspiring quotes, and light-hearted wishes can convey the day's significance to loved ones and colleagues. Whether seeking peace, expressing gratitude, or offering a moment of introspection, thoughtful words can make a meaningful difference, fostering connection and faith.

title: Dalit baraat attacked in Agra over loud music; groom thrashed, pulled off mare
content: In Agra's Garhi Rammi village, a Dalit wedding procession was allegedly attacked by upper-caste individuals due to loud music. The groom was assaulted, robbed, and guests were injured, prompting a police investigation and the detention of two suspects. This incident follows a similar attack in March, highlighting ongoing caste-based tensions in the area.

title: Nanguneri SC boy who was attacked by gang not cooperating with investigators: police
content: He even refuses to share his social media and e-mail IDs and the passwords, which are needed for identifying the attackers as he had been invited by the ‘unidentified friend’ to come to the secluded place through the social media, police say.

title: Experts link Buldhana patients’ nail deformities, hair loss cases to selenium exposure
content: Health experts had said that the wheat sourced from Punjab and Haryana, and distributed through ration shops in Buldhana, were noted to contain significantly high levels of selenium

title: Congress says Supreme Court’s observation on Waqf echoes concerns raised by INDIA bloc
content: The party says its opposition to the amended law is not just to defend a particular community but to protect constitutional principles

title: Dhaka’s actions led to India’s closure of transshipment facility for Bangladesh: MEA
content: Sources say Bangladesh’s closure of land ports with India has been viewed as a “regressive step”; officials also point to cargo inspections, stoppage of yarn imports

title: IT Park development in 450 acres in Puppalaguda: Telangana Deputy CM Bhatti
content: The land earmarked for the IT hub includes areas previously allotted to the housing societies of MLAs, MPs, IAS officers and revenue officials

title: Mamata appeals to Governor to not visit Murshidabad; Bose says he wants to see ground situation
content: ‘I am going to the field to see for myself the realities in the field. Only then, I will be able to make up my mind on the future course of action and give reports to whoever is concerned,’ the Governor said

title: Tejashwi to lead INDIA alliance co-ordination committee for Bihar election
content: The co-ordination committee would be responsible for all election related issues including seat-sharing, manifesto and campaign strategy; no talks held yet on CM face

title: India’s airport expansion plans need revised seat agreements: Dubai airport CEO
content: Dubai’s second airport, which will replace the current primary hub in mid-2030s, is set to open after first phase of expansion in 2027 with an annual capacity of 150 million passengers

title: Organ pledging: Karnataka has the fourth highest number of registrations
content: The highest pledging has been recorded in the age group of 30-45 years with 16,045 persons in this age group pledging their organs

title: Over 30 killed in US strikes on Yemeni fuel port; explosion sparks huge fireball
content: US airstrikes on Yemen's Ras Isa oil port, confirmed by CENTCOM, resulted in reported casualties, with Houthis claiming 30 deaths and 50 injuries. CENTCOM stated the action aimed to eliminate fuel sources for the Houthis, denying any intention to harm Yemeni civilians.

title: 'Not blaming him, but not thrilled either': Trump on Zelenskyy over Russia-Ukraine war
content: Donald Trump softened his stance on Volodymyr Zelenskyy, stating he doesn't blame him for the Russian invasion but criticizes his leadership during the war. A long-delayed minerals agreement between the US and Ukraine is expected to be signed soon, potentially granting the US access to Ukraine's rare earth resources.

title: Hardik Pandya calls this player Mumbai Indians' 'gun fielder'
content: Hardik Pandya lauded Mumbai Indians' bowlers for their strategic variations on a slow pitch, leading to a four-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. MI's disciplined bowling restricted SRH to 162, which they chased down with ease, thanks to Will Jacks' all-round performance. Pat Cummins acknowledged SRH's total was insufficient on the challenging Wankhede surface.

title: ED set to turn up heat on Vadra, readies chargesheets in 3 cases
content: The Enforcement Directorate is likely to file prosecution complaints against Robert Vadra in multiple money laundering cases, including the Gurgaon land deal. These cases also involve alleged links to arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari and the Bikaner land deal. Vadra's questioning follows charges against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, intensifying scrutiny on financial dealings.

title: Government points to Dhaka's role in disrupting trade ties with India
content: Despite strained trade relations with Bangladesh, India asserts its commitment to regional trade, clarifying that the trans-shipment facility withdrawal aimed to ease port congestion without impacting Bangladesh's exports to Nepal and Bhutan. India has expressed concerns over Bangladesh's restrictive trade measures, including port closures and yarn import blocks, alongside its renewed ties with Pakistan, raising security concerns for India.

title: DGCA may allow arts, commerce 12th pass students to turn pilots
content: In a significant reform, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is considering removing the mandatory physics and maths requirement in class 12 for commercial pilot license (CPL) training. This move aims to open the field to arts and commerce students, aligning India with global standards.

title: Person sips coffee, strolls past victim amid shooting at Florida State Univ
content: A video circulating online shows an individual, believed to be a student, casually drinking coffee while walking past a bloodied shooting victim at Florida State University. The person filmed the scene instead of offering assistance. The shooting, which resulted in two fatalities and multiple injuries, involved a suspect identified as Phoenix Ikner, an FSU student.

title: No SC stay as govt puts key waqf law provisions on hold
content: The Union government assured the Supreme Court it would refrain from appointments to the Central Waqf Council and Auqaf Boards, maintaining the status quo on waqf properties. This assurance preempted a potential stay on contentious provisions of the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: CRPF backbone of mission to eliminate Naxalism by March next year: Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised the CRPF for significantly curbing Naxal influence, confining them to a few districts and aiming to eliminate Naxalism by March 2026. He highlighted the crucial role of the CoBRA battalion in this effort, noting a 70% reduction in violence due to CRPF's presence.

title: Will Jacks all-round show help Mumbai beat Hyderabad at Wankhede
content: Riding on Will Jacks' impactful all-round performance, Mumbai Indians secured a four-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad at Wankhede Stadium. Jacks' crucial wickets of Travis Head and Ishan Kishan, coupled with his contribution of 36 runs, propelled Mumbai to their second consecutive win. Despite Heinrich Klaasen's late surge, SRH's total of 162/5 proved insufficient against Mumbai's strong batting lineup.

title: SC: No foul words used, banner depicts homebuyers' grievances
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that peaceful protests by homebuyers, including holding banners expressing grievances against realtors, do not constitute defamation if no abusive language is used. The court emphasized the importance of the right to dissent lawfully as part of freedom of speech.

title: WB governor refuses to heed CM request not to visit violence-hit Murshidabad
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and Governor CV Ananda Bose are at odds over Murshidabad, with Banerjee urging against visits to avoid escalating tensions following Waqf law-related violence. Bose intends to assess the situation and report to the Centre, having met with affected individuals.

title: Tom Brady hints at betrayal as Gisele Bündchen gets closer to new baby daddy
content: Tom Brady, celebrated for his unmatched NFL success, is now revealing a vulnerable side, particularly after his divorce from Gisele Bündchen. He openly acknowledges the emotional toll and hints at past "willful blindness" regarding his marriage. This shift signals a new chapter for Brady, where emotional authenticity complements his on-field legacy, reminding everyone that even icons grapple with personal pain.

title: Hurriyat chairperson Mirwaiz welcomes interim SC directions in Waqf Act case
content: Kashmir’s chief cleric Mirwaiz Umar Farooq said the interim directions gave “hope to Muslims, who look up to the SC as their last recourse for relief and justice”

title: Karnataka’s caste census: BJP asks if there is a ‘conspiracy’ to blackmail Ministers by asking them to furnish views in writing
content: Leader of Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok alleged that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had brought the caste census report to the forefront to escape from people’s ire against his government over a slew of issues, including price-rise

title: ‘Torture’ in custody: J&K High Court directs police to submit its report
content: The victim’s family has moved the court to seek the transfer of the probe to the Central Bureau of Investigation, ‘so that the investigation is conducted fairly and independently and in an impartial manner’

title: Andhra Pradesh promulgates Ordinance on sub-classification of Scheduled Castes
content: It seeks to provide a legal framework to classify the communities into three sub-groups to address disparities in representation and access to welfare schemes

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) backs Mamata’s claim, accuses BJP of fuelling Bengal violence
content: “Wherever the BJP fails to form a government — be it Kerala, Tamil Nadu, or Bengal — they try to create unrest”

title: Paddy harvesting picks up in Yadgir
content: But growers in the district are worrying over the yield falling short of their expectation due to shortage of water during a crucial period

title: IUML has no moral right to oppose amendment while eyeing Waqf land, says INL leader
content: He alleged that 22 acres, originally owned by a tax-paying Jamaat mosque and leased for 99 years to the college, had effectively been appropriated by the IUML-controlled CDMEA

title: India’s defence sector ready to play important role in global supply chain resilience, says Rajnath
content: Defence Minister noted that domestic defence capabilities serve as credible deterrence, maintaining peace and tranquillity in a dual bid to ensure national security and strategic autonomy.

title: TNPCB study shows elevated levels of mercury in waterbodies near NLCIL
content: The TNPCB study, with water samples collected on December 17, 2024, was undertaken following the intervention of the NGT, the report of which was submitted on Wednesday

title: Ahead of talks on trade pact with US, chief negotiator heads to DC
content: India's chief negotiator Rajesh Agrawal will visit Washington DC next week to meet with US counterparts, paving the way for initial discussions on a proposed bilateral trade agreement. This visit aims to resolve outstanding issues before the formal trade talks commence.

title: It's open & shut case, Cong workers should protest against Gandhis: Puri
content: The BJP has intensified its attack on the Gandhi family regarding the National Herald case, labeling it a clear instance of fraud and money laundering. BJP leader Hardeep Singh Puri asserted that Congress workers are being misled by leaders implicated in the chargesheet.

title: Pakistan General remark bid to stir India unrest?
content: Pakistan's army chief, Gen Asim Munir, delivered a provocative speech urging Pakistanis to uphold the 'two-nation theory,' sparking concerns in India. Intelligence sources view this as a diversionary tactic amid internal security challenges and escalating conflicts with the TTP and Baloch insurgents.

title: Sunny Deol starrer 'Jaat' film closes first week with Rs 61.5 crore in India
content: Sunny Deol's action film 'Jaat' maintained a steady performance at the box office on its eighth day, earning ₹4 crore domestically. Despite lacking romance and appealing music, the film, directed by Gopichand Malineni, primarily attracts male audiences in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. 'Jaat' faces competition from the newly released 'Kesari Chapter 2' during the Good Friday weekend.

title: Dhankhar slams SC timeline for decision on bills
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar criticized the Supreme Court's ruling that set a timeline for the President and governors to decide on bills. He questioned the court's authority to direct the President and expressed concern over the use of Article 142, deeming it a 'nuclear missile' against democratic forces.

title: SC seeks Centre reply on Muslims opting for secular inheritance law
content: The Supreme Court is considering petitions from a Muslim woman, an NGO, and an advocate challenging the inheritance provisions of Sharia law, arguing they discriminate against women. They seek the freedom to follow the secular Indian Succession Act instead.

title: 'Guns don't shoot ... ': What Trump said after Florida State Univ shooting
content: Following the tragic shooting at Florida State University that resulted in two fatalities and six injuries, president Trump expressed his condolences, labeling the event as "terrible." Despite the incident, Trump reaffirmed his unwavering commitment to upholding the second amendment, emphasising that he would not consider tightening gun laws.

title: Katie Thurston breaks down over stage 4 breast cancer battle
content: Reality star Katie Thurston reveals her stage 4 breast cancer diagnosis. She shares her struggles with loneliness during treatment. Her husband's work requires frequent travel. Online support from other cancer survivors provides hope. Katie has started hormone-blocking therapy instead of chemotherapy. This new plan aims for long-term control with fewer side effects.

title: Plea unheard by Bombay HC, SC stays notice after dargah razed
content: The Supreme Court intervened by ordering a stay on the demolition notice for the Hazrat Saatpeer Sayed Baba dargah in Nashik. However, the Nashik Municipal Corporation had already demolished the structure before the hearing, leading to violence and injuries to 21 policemen.

title: Made waqf law after 1,700 plaints from Muslims: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated that the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, was introduced after receiving numerous complaints from the Muslim community, particularly women and widows, regarding the previous system. He emphasized that the new law aims to address these grievances and empower those who suffered under the old regulations, ensuring justice for victims, especially widows.

title: Amber Fort, City Palace on Veep JD Vance's Jaipur agenda
content: Jaipur is making preparations to welcome US Vice-President J D Vance, his wife Usha, and their children on April 22. During their visit, Vance will meet with industry leaders and government officials, as well as tour Amber Fort and City Palace. He is also scheduled to speak at an industry event focused on trade and technology.

title: Congress, BJP trade barbs over Herald case
content: The Congress party is set to intensify its protests against the alleged misuse of investigative agencies by the BJP government, with a key meeting scheduled to strategize further action. These demonstrations are expected to coincide with potential government actions against the Gandhi family, particularly in light of the National Herald case.

title: As Farooq cries foul, Dulat says his book praises former J&K CM
content: Farooq Abdullah disputes A S Dulat's claim of supporting Article 370 abrogation, but Dulat clarifies he meant Abdullah's desire to align with Delhi on his terms. Dulat's book praises Abdullah's leadership, revealing insights into the Rubaiya Sayeed abduction and IC-814 hostage swap, highlighting Farooq's initial opposition and eventual acquiescence to decisions.

title: US strikes destroy key Yemen port, 'economic power' of Iran-backed Houthis
content: The US military's Central Command (CENTCOM) announced the destruction of Yemen's Ras Isa Port, aiming to weaken the Houthis' economic power. According to CENTCOM, the Houthis exploit fuel resources to fund military operations and destabilize the region. The action seeks to cut off this revenue stream, hindering the Houthis' ability to conduct terrorist activities.

title: Mayawati cautions Dalits amid SP outreach, terms statements as politics of narrow selfishness
content: The former Uttar Pradesh CM asks Dalits, backward classes, and minorities not to fall prey to the SP’s tactics

title: As bike taxi ban looms, Bengalureans turn to carpooling for daily commute
content: For thousands of daily commuters, bike taxis have been a low-cost, time-saving solution in the traffic-congested city.

title: National Herald an open-and-shut case of fraud, corruption, and money laundering, alleges BJP
content: At a press conference, senior BJP leader and Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri says the Congress workers should protest against their own leadership for allegedly misusing a charitable entity and the party’s resources for their own personal gain

title: ASI finds centuries-old rock art sites in Mizoram
content: The discoveries were made during a survey conducted across villages in four districts, officials said

title: Palghar district in Maharashtra trains 259 gram panchayats in disaster management
content: Earlier such kits were only distributed among the Tehsildars in taluka level and fire brigades; this is the first time that gram panchayats are being given disaster kits

title: Nellore IAB allocates 41 tmcft water for over 3 lakh acres in Rabi season
content: Water from Somasila reservoir will be released to the crop canals from May 5, says Endowments during the IAB meeting

title: Wanted: Munni, Wife Of Chhote. Arrested: Munni, Wife of Janaki
content: The police in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly were on the hunt for a woman named Munni. They caught Munni, but there was a catch. She was Munni, but not the Munni they were looking for.

title: Indian Embassy Repatriates 4 Nationals Scammed In Myanmar's Myawaddy
content: The Indian Embassy in Myanmar on Friday said that four Indian nationals who were victims of scam operations in Myawaddy have been repatriated.

title: Donald Trump Continues Attacks On Universities, Calls Harvard "A Disgrace"
content: Hundreds of students, faculty and community members on a California campus booed as speakers accused the administration of President Donald Trump of undermining American universities.

title: "Good Friday Inspires Us To Cherish Kindness, Compassion": PM Modi
content: On Good Friday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the day inspires us to cherish kindness, compassion and always be large-hearted.

title: Terrorist Behind 14 Blasts In Punjab Caught In US, First Visual Of Him In Custody
content: An image of US-based terrorist Harpreet Singh in custody of the FBI was released after he was arrested by the Immigration Department.

title: "Darkest Hour Before Dawn": Bengal Governor Heads To Violence-Hit Murshidabad
content: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose has announced an official visit to violence-hit Murshidabad, declaring his intent to "impose peace at any cost."

title: US Unveils New Port Fees For Chinese-Linked Ships
content: The United States unveiled new port fees on Chinese built and operated ships, in a bid to boost the domestic shipbuilding industry and curb China's dominance in the sector.

title: Row At Mumbai Apartment Complex After Non-Vegetarians Called "Dirty"
content: The Mumbai Police intervened to defuse tension between members of the Gujarati community and Marathi-speaking residents over consuming non-vegetarian food in the city's Ghatkopar neighbourhood yesterday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Am I Indian Enough? - By Derek O'Brien
content: Who gets to decide how much is enough? Enough to practice our faith without suspicion? Enough to exist without having to prove our belonging every single day?

title: India's Elephant Warning System Tackles Deadly Conflict
content: An app, developed by Indian firm Kalpvaig, crunches the data and then triggers warnings about movement of elephants to nearby villagers.

title: Environment Ministry must roll back order on desulphurising coal plants: study
content: The study was commissioned by the Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser, and executed by the National Institute of Advanced Studies, Bengaluru

title: Tension in Tirupati as police place YSRCP leader Karunakar Reddy under house arrest
content: Accepting the challenge thrown by the TDP, the former TTD chairman vowed to visit the Goshala to prove his charges on cow deaths

title: Bypoll: Congress undecided between two aspirants in Nilambur
content: V.S. Joy,  president of Malappuram District Congress Committee,  and  Aryadan Shoukath, State general secretary of Congress, are firm on their candidacy

title: Akshaya entrepreneurs cry out for service fee revision
content: Repeated memoranda to the State government for the revision of service fee invoked no response despite the district and State offices of the Akshaya project flagging the concerns of Akshaya entrepreneurs

title: IMF Sees US-China Trade Grievances, Welcomes India Tariff Cuts
content: IMF said that the US and China both have trade grievances, but the world's two largest economies needed to reduce uncertainty and agree on a fairer trading system.

title: "Misleading": TCS Denies Bias Towards Indian Staff In US During Layoffs
content: The allegations have been levelled by former employees largely of non-South Asian descent, who say the company targeted them for layoffs.

title: Deadly US Strikes Hit Yemen Port Used By Houthis, 20 Killed, 50 Injured
content: The US military said it had destroyed a key Yemeni fuel port as it targets the country's Houthi rebels, who said Friday that 20 people had been killed in the strikes.

title: Indian-Origin Doctor Convicted In Health Care Fraud Conspiracies In US
content: An Indian-descent doctor has been convicted of participating in a $2.3 million conspiracy to illegally distribute controlled substances and of healthcare fraud, according to the US Justice Department.

title: 2 Killed, 5 Injured In Mass Shooting By Student At Florida State University
content: A suspect has been taken into police custody, and multiple victims were reported in a shooting Thursday at Florida State University, a person familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.

title: Bengaluru Man's Chai Reel Lands Him In Trouble, Was Shooting On Busy Road
content: A Bengaluru man has been arrested after a video of his dangerous stunt on a public road, posted on Instagram, drew the attention of the police.

title: Trump Says 'No Rush' To End Tariffs On European Union In Meet With Meloni
content: Donald Trump and Giorgia Meloni hit an optimistic note about a possible US-EU tariffs deal Thursday as the far-right Italian prime minister mounted a charm offensive at the White House.

title: Harvard: University Of Presidents, Tech Titans, Trump Allies
content: The latest target of President Donald Trump's ire, Harvard has long been viewed as among the world's best universities, producing future presidents, Nobel laureates, tech stars -- and Trump allies.

title: Body Of UP Fisherman Who Died In Pakistani Jail Expected To Arrive Today
content: The dead body of Ghurahu Bind, a fisherman from this Uttar Pradesh district who died under mysterious circumstances in a Pakistani jail, are expected to arrive at his native village on Friday, District Magistrate Dinesh Chandra said.

title: US Man Attempts To Hijack Plane, Shot Dead By Passenger: Report
content: A knife-wielding US citizen attempted to hijack a small Tropic Air plane in Belize on Thursday (local time), injuring three people before being shot dead by a fellow passenger, the New York Post reported, citing officials.

title: Why Shedeur Sanders' NFL draft process, stardom are like nothing we've seen before
content: shedeur Sanders is projected as a top-10 pick and the second quarterback chosen on April 24 . he was greeted by the Denver Broncos head coach Sean Payton . payton was one of three head coaches among a group of around 80 league personnel and 150 media members .

title: 'I have a superpower now': Jack Bech leans on late brother's memory in pursuit of NFL dreams
content: "this is going to be the next kid that plays on Sundays," he says . the coaches had coached Tiger Bech, his older brother, an aggressive, fiery, but diminutive all-purpose talent . "Before Jack, Tiger was the best receiver we've ever had," says coach .

title: Spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content:
Pete Thamel tells Pat McAfee that Nico Iamaleava is unlikely find a situation where he gets his asking price through the portal. (1:17) College football 's spring transfer portal period opened Wednesday and runs through April 25. More than  2,700 players  have elected to transfer this offseason. This period is the last chance for underclassmen to switch teams before the start of the 2025 season and for schools to bolster their roster. The biggest news of the spring period happened this past weekend when  Tennessee   parted ways  with quarterback  Nico Iamaleava . The former four-star recruit, who threw 19 touchdown passes in 2024, was seeking an increase in his  NIL package . He is now looking for a new home, and  UCLA is in the hunt . With players officially able to enter their names in the portal, we tracked all the latest news and developments. Here's a look at how Day 1 unfolded.  Transfer portal coverage: 
 Best available player rankings

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers, Mets or Padres No. 1 this week?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers have fallen from the top spot thanks to a recent rough patch . the New york Mets, San Diego Padres or San Francisco Giants replaced the defending champions atop our week 3 Power Rankings .

title: In Jade Carey's final meet, can she win the NCAA all-around title?
content: JADE CAREY is one of the country's most decorated elite gymnasts . the 24-year-old will represent Oregon State for the last time at the NCAA championships in Fort Worth, Texas . she has won three gold medals and three world championship titles . her love for Oregon State has never wavered .

title: 'Yeet!': The unexpected and highly unlikely rise of WWE's Jey Uso
content: JEY USO is not supposed to be in the world heavyweight title match vs. Gunther . he never dreamed of standing tall by himself at WrestleMania as a champion . jey and Jimmy Uso have accomplished everything a tag team could want in WWE .

title: PFL best bets: How Impa Kasanganay can bounce back
content: Impa Kasanganay, who won the 2023 light heavyweight season, takes on Fabian Edwards in one of four middleweight bouts . the card at Universal Studios also features four lightweight bouts, including Gadzhi Rabadanov taking on Marc Diakiese .
